Articles.Content:
Post your favorite chemical please do not say dihydrogen monoxide (water)

mine is sulfer hexafloride

dihydrogen monoxide, of course

Mine is Carbon, because of its insane versatility.
Chemical or chemical compound? There is a difference.

Probably a reasonably large crystal. Hard to get attached to something at the typical molecular size.

Of course after "blowing up" (read two foot flame) cyclohexane in my first chemistry lab, I'll always remember that one.

Everything always comes down to water...

Mine would be sulphur dioxide. You know instantly when there's some present.

PS why the heck is my spellcheck freaking out about spelling it "sulphur" rather than "sulfur"?

EDIT: Dangit, upon looking it up I now realize that I meant "hydrogen sulphide". Though I'd assume both would be equally smelly...

Edited October 16, 2015 by moogoob
Nitrous Oxide, funniest of all !

If you want favorite chemical, double stranded polydeoxyribonuceic acid. If you want most imporatnt, hydrogen.

If you want life you need stability, if you want stability you need H, alot and some contaminates.

Ethanol?

Glucose can be nice too

Has to be diethyl ether! It's literately the best non-polar solvent available over the counter. I always keep a few bottles laying around. Removing glue residue, cleaning paint brushes, removing permanent marker writing, getting candle wax out of fabric, you name it. Only downside is that it stinks the place up and the vapors make you drowsy.

Everything always comes down to water...

Mine would be sulphur dioxide. You know instantly when there's some present.

PS why the heck is my spellcheck freaking out about spelling it "sulphur" rather than "sulfur"?

EDIT: Dangit, upon looking it up I now realize that I meant "hydrogen sulphide". Though I'd assume both would be equally smelly...

SO2 isn't as smelly as SH2, but it does have a very distinctive odour (Its the smell of a freshly lit match)

Boranes are my favourite, as they are some very powerful acids, as well as being delightfully unstable!

Silicon I love silicon in all its varieties - from glass to beach sand to semiconductors inside my laptop. I could say carbon too - but since most of me that isn't water contains the carbon, my opinion is biased

Ozone is pretty cool, but the best is the heme ! A bit complex, but it has all the interesting stuff in a single molecule !

SPÃ‚Â³DÃ‚Â² hybridation of the (ionized) most stable element in the universe, amusing mesomeric effects, and pretty much necessary for you and me ! plus, bloody scenes in action movies would suck without it ^^
Probably Coca-cola.
H2O. It's tasty.

http://www.uoxray.uoregon.edu/phys161/caffeine.jpg

Sugar, which goes hand-in-hand with StrandedonEarth's (finely, freshly ground beans please) ... plus some hot water ..... and some cream thank you.
Dopamine because I'm happy (it's stuck in my head now)
Ammonium chloride. Tasty.

Dopamine because I'm happy (it's stuck in my head now)
You could have worded that infinitely better.

Mine would have to be Dimethylboranyl(methyl)silicon. I do not know why.

Edited October 17, 2015 by Xannari Ferrows
Oxygen, of course! What can't it do? Breathing, rocket fuel, explosions, rust, fire.

Silicon I love silicon in all its varieties - from glass to beach sand to semiconductors inside my laptop. I could say carbon too - but since most of me that isn't water contains the carbon, my opinion is biased

Those are elements, which can be part of chemicals... but carbon and silicon are not chemicals

Dopamine because I'm happy (it's stuck in my head now)

That's not gonna make you feel happy though... If you want to feel great, you should consider serotonin instead !
Chlorine Trifluoride. You can't get more Kerbal than that.

Those are elements, which can be part of chemicals... but carbon and silicon are not chemicals

All right Then...this - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titin

Just don't ask me to write full name of this monster down

Not kidding here, water is pretty great.

Other than that... NaCl.
